definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: I shake the head, afterwards then the corona arrived, only hears an alarm signal sound.
sentences.chinese: 我搖頭，之後便暈到了，只聽到一陣警號聲。

sentences.english: We took the mew of a cat as a sound of warning.
sentences.chinese: 我們把貓的叫聲誤聽成是警號了。

sentences.english: It is suitable for road mark and warning with a 15W lamp.
sentences.chinese: 適用於道路障礙及有關警號標誌。

sentences.english: Even if America heeds its warning, there is precious little it can do about it.
sentences.chinese: 即使美國留意到這個警號，但是它能做的可能爲零。

sentences.english: A warning siren at the entrance of the ventilation tunnel was switched on to notify workers for evacuation.
sentences.chinese: 通風隧道入口處的警號開著，示意工人疏散。

sentences.english: A2 - Please dial the extension, then press the pound key.
sentences.chinese: 請按分機號，然後按下警號鍵。

sentences.english: Economic indicators in recent months have set alarm bells ringing.
sentences.chinese: 近月的經濟指標已響起警號。

sentences.english: The church bells were rung as flood warning.
sentences.chinese: 那時敲響教堂的鐘作爲水災的警號。

definition: to turn a blind eye to
top priority job/matter of vital importance
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to apply for (a subsidy, unemployment benefit etc)
